member.summary: Module (narrow bar) width in dots.

member.summary: Wide bar to narrow bar ratio.

member.summary: Default bar height in dots.

member.summary: Factory for creating ZPL command instances from tokens.

member.summary: Creates a ZPL command from a command code.
member.returns: A new command instance, or null if command is not supported.

member.summary: Checks if a command code is supported.

member.summary: Gets a list of all supported command codes.

member.name: T:ZplRenderer.Commands.FieldOriginCommand
member.summary: ^FO - Field Origin command. Sets the X,Y position for the next field. Format: ^FOx,y,z

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Commands.FieldOriginCommand.X
member.summary: X position in dots from left edge.

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Commands.FieldOriginCommand.Y
member.summary: Y position in dots from top edge.

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Commands.FieldOriginCommand.Justification
member.summary: Justification (0=left, 1=right, 2=auto).

member.name: T:ZplRenderer.Commands.FieldTypesetCommand
member.summary: ^FT - Field Typeset command. Sets the X,Y position relative to baseline. Format: ^FTx,y,z

member.name: T:ZplRenderer.Commands.FieldBlockCommand
member.summary: ^FB - Field Block command. Allows printing text into a defined block. Format: ^FBw,l,s,j,h w = width of block in dots l = max number of lines s = space between lines in dots (added to font height) j = justification (L, C, R, J) h = hanging indent (dots)

member.name: T:ZplRenderer.Commands.FieldReverseCommand
member.summary: ^FR - Field Reverse Print command. Prints white on black background. Format: ^FR

member.name: T:ZplRenderer.Commands.FieldDataCommand
member.summary: ^FD - Field Data command. Defines the data/text content of a field. Format: ^FDdata

member.summary: The field data content.

member.name: T:ZplRenderer.Commands.DownloadGraphicsCommand

member.name: T:ZplRenderer.Commands.RecallGraphicCommand

member.summary: ^IM - Image Move. Loads an image from storage. Format: ^IMd:o.x

member.name: T:ZplRenderer.Commands.MediaModeCommand
member.summary: Comandi ZPL che non influenzano il rendering ma devono essere riconosciuti dal parser per evitare warning "comando non supportato". Questi comandi controllano solo il comportamento fisico della stampante.

^MM: Media Mode - controlla la modalita' di stampa (tear-off, peel-off, cutter, ecc.). Non ha effetto sul rendering visivo dell'etichetta. Formato: ^MMm,p dove m = modalita' (T/P/R/C/U/K), p = pre-peel (Y/N)

member.name: T:ZplRenderer.Commands.CommentCommand
member.summary: ^FX: Commento nel codice ZPL. Il tokenizer gestisce il contenuto del commento: tutto fino al prossimo ^ viene incluso nei parametri e ignorato. Utile per annotazioni e documentazione inline nel codice ZPL.

member.summary: Offset Y della label home (impostato da ^LH).

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplLabel.CharacterEncoding
member.summary: Encoding internazionale corrente (impostato da ^CI). 0 = USA1, 1-15 = vari encoding internazionali.

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplLabel.PrintOrientation
member.summary: Orientamento dell'etichetta (impostato da ^PO). N = Normal, I = Inverted, R = Rotated 90°, B = Bottom/Rotated 270°

member.summary: Modalità di stampa (impostata da ^MM). T = Tear-off, P = Peel-off, R = Rewind, C = Cutter, D = Delayed cut, K = Kiosk

member.summary: Indica se il formato è valido (ha ^XA e ^XZ).

member.summary: Messaggi di validazione o warning raccolti durante il parsing.

member.summary: Metadata aggiuntivi dell'etichetta (nome formato, versione, ecc.).

member.summary: Applico le impostazioni dal contesto di parsing alla label. Questo metodo viene chiamato dal parser dopo aver processato tutti i comandi.

member.summary: Calcolo la larghezza in pollici basandomi sulla densità.

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplLabel.HeightInches
member.summary: Calcolo l'altezza in pollici basandomi sulla densità.

member.summary: Calcolo la larghezza in millimetri.

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplLabel.HeightMillimeters
member.summary: Calcolo l'altezza in millimetri.

member.summary: Eccezione lanciata durante il parsing di codice ZPL.

member.summary: Contesto di parsing che mantiene lo stato durante l'interpretazione del codice ZPL. I comandi modal (^FH, ^CI, ^FO, ^A, ecc.) influenzano i comandi successivi.

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplParserContext.ResetLabelState
member.summary: Resetto lo stato per una nuova etichetta (dopo ^XA o ^XZ).

member.name: T:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplParser
member.summary: Parsa il codice ZPL e crea una ZplLabel con tutti i comandi. Gestisce lo stato dei comandi modal e la validazione avanzata.

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplParser.#ctor
member.summary: Creo un nuovo parser ZPL.

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplParser.Parse(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Parso il codice ZPL e restituisco una label con i comandi parsati.
member.param: La stringa di codice ZPL grezzo.
Se true, lancia eccezioni per errori di parsing. Altrimenti li ignora.
member.returns: Una ZplLabel contenente tutti i comandi parsati.

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplParser.UpdateContextBeforeParsing(ZplRenderer.Core.ZplToken,ZplRenderer.Core.ZplParserContext)
member.summary: Aggiorno il contesto prima di parsare un comando. Gestisco comandi speciali come ^XA, ^DF, ecc.

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplParser.PrepareParameters(ZplRenderer.Core.ZplToken,ZplRenderer.Core.ZplParserContext,ZplRenderer.Commands.ZplCommand)
member.summary: Preparo i parametri per il comando in base al contesto. Gestisco casi speciali come ^FD con ^FH attivo.

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplParser.ApplyContextToCommand(ZplRenderer.Commands.ZplCommand,ZplRenderer.Core.ZplParserContext)
member.summary: Applico informazioni dal contesto al comando appena parsato. Posso estendere questo per applicare font corrente, posizione, ecc.

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplParser.UpdateContextAfterParsing(ZplRenderer.Core.ZplToken,ZplRenderer.Commands.ZplCommand,ZplRenderer.Core.ZplParserContext)
member.summary: Aggiorno il contesto dopo aver parsato un comando. I comandi modal influenzano i comandi successivi.

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplParser.DecodeHexIndicators(System.String,System.Char)
member.summary: Decodifico gli indicatori hex nel formato _XX dove _ � l'hex indicator. Esempio: "Test_0A_0DHello" con indicator '_' diventa "Test\n\rHello"

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplParser.IsHexString(System.String)
member.summary: Verifico se una stringa � valida hex (0-9, A-F).

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplParser.ExtractFormatName(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Estraggo il nome del formato da ^DF. Formato: d:o.x (device:objectname.extension)

member.summary: Aggiorno le propriet� della label in base ai comandi parsati.

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplParser.Validate(System.String)
member.summary: Valido il codice ZPL e restituisco eventuali warning o errori.
member.param: La stringa di codice ZPL grezzo.

member.name: T:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplToken
member.summary: Rappresenta un comando ZPL tokenizzato.

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplToken.Prefix
member.summary: Il prefisso del comando (^ o ~).

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplToken.CommandCode
member.summary: Il codice del comando (es. FO, FD, A0, GB, BC, BQ). Per i comandi font ^A, include il font identifier (es. "A0", "AE").

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplToken.Parameters
member.summary: La stringa dei parametri grezzi dopo il codice comando.

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplToken.RawContent
member.summary: Contenuto grezzo originale del token.

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplToken.Position
member.summary: Posizione del token nel codice sorgente (utile per debug).

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplToken.Length
member.summary: Lunghezza del token nel codice sorgente.

member.name: T:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplTokenizer
member.summary:
Tokenizza il codice ZPL in token di comando.
Implementazione basata su scanner carattere per carattere (NO regex). I comandi ZPL iniziano SEMPRE con ^ o ~ seguiti da 1-2 lettere/cifre. I parametri sono tutto il testo tra il codice comando e il prossimo ^ o ~.
Casi speciali gestiti: - ^FD, ^SN, ^FV: terminano con ^FS (il contenuto puo' includere ^ o ~) - ^GF: dati grafici con byte count - ~DG, ~DY: download con dati hex/binari - ^DF: formato memorizzato, termina con ^XZ - ^FX: commento, tutto fino al prossimo ^ viene ignorato - ^A: il font identifier (0-9, A-Z) fa parte del codice comando

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplTokenizer.Tokenize(System.String)
member.summary: Tokenizza il codice ZPL in singoli token di comando. Scansiona carattere per carattere cercando solo ^ e ~ come delimitatori.
member.param: La stringa di codice ZPL grezzo.

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplTokenizer.ExtractCommandCode(System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary:
Estrae il codice comando dalla posizione corrente.
Regole ZPL per i codici comando: - La maggior parte dei comandi ha 2 caratteri (FO, FD, GB, BC, XA, FS, ecc.) - Il comando ^A (font) e' speciale: ^A seguito da un identificatore font (0-9, A-Z) forma un codice di 2 caratteri (es. A0, AE) ma il font identifier e' semanticamente il primo parametro. Lo includiamo nel codice per compatibilita' con CommandFactory. - Comandi monocarattere: ^A da solo (raro), ~J (host commands)

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplTokenizer.IsFieldDataCommand(System.String)
member.summary: Comandi che terminano con ^FS: il contenuto puo' contenere ^ e ~ letterali. ^FD (Field Data), ^SN (Serialization), ^FV (Field Variable).

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplTokenizer.IsDownloadFormatCommand(System.String)
member.summary: ^DF: Download Format, contiene un formato ZPL completo che termina con ^XZ.

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplTokenizer.IsDownloadCommand(System.Char,System.String)
member.summary: Comandi di download con dati binari/hex (~DG, ~DB, ~DS, ~DT, ~DU, ~DY). Usano il prefisso ~ e hanno formati speciali con byte count.

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplTokenizer.ParseStandardParameters(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Parsing standard: legge i parametri fino al prossimo ^ o ~. Usato per la maggior parte dei comandi ZPL.

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplTokenizer.ParseUntilFieldSeparator(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Parsing per ^FD, ^SN, ^FV: legge tutto fino a ^FS. Il contenuto puo' includere ^ e ~ come caratteri letterali. Se ^FS non viene trovato (ZPL malformato), fallback a parsing standard.

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplTokenizer.ParseUntilEndFormat(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Parsing per ^DF: legge tutto fino a ^XZ (formato memorizzato completo).

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplTokenizer.ParseComment(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Parsing per ^FX (commento ZPL): legge fino al prossimo ^. Il commento viene ignorato dal rendering.

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplTokenizer.ParseGraphicField(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Parsing per ^GF (Graphic Field). Formato: ^GFa,b,c,d,data a = tipo compressione (A=ASCII, B=Binary, C=Compressed) b = binary byte count c = graphic field count (totale byte) d = bytes per row data = dati hex (per ASCII: c*2 caratteri)

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplTokenizer.ParseDownloadCommand(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Parsing per comandi di download (~DG, ~DY, ecc). Formato ~DG: d:o.x,t,w,data (t = total bytes, data = hex)

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplTokenizer.ParseDGCommand(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Parsing specifico per ~DG (Download Graphics). Formato: ~DGd:o.x,t,w,data d = dispositivo, o = nome, x = estensione t = total bytes, w = bytes per riga data = dati hex ASCII

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplTokenizer.FindNextCommandDelimiter(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Trova il prossimo delimitatore di comando (^ o ~) nella stringa ZPL. Restituisce -1 se non trovato.

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.Core.ZplTokenizer.IsAlphaNumeric(System.Char)
member.summary: Verifica se un carattere e' alfanumerico (A-Z, a-z, 0-9).

member.summary: Context passed to drawers during the rendering phase.

member.summary: The X,Y coordinates represent the baseline origin of the text. Corresponds to ^FT (Field Typeset).

member.summary: How the X,Y coordinates should be interpreted.

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Elements.ZplElement.IsReversePrint
member.summary: If true, rendering should be inverted (white on black).

member.summary: Impostazioni Field Block (^FB) se attive.

member.summary: Represents Field Block settings (^FB).

member.summary: Represents a graphic box or line (^GB).

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Elements.ZplGraphicBox.CornerRounding
member.summary: Grado di arrotondamento degli angoli (0-8). 0 = angoli retti, 8 = massimo arrotondamento (il raggio è proporzionale al lato minore). Corrisponde al 5° parametro del comando ^GB.

member.name: T:ZplRenderer.Elements.ZplGraphicEllipse
member.summary: Represents a graphic ellipse (^GE).

member.name: T:ZplRenderer.Elements.ZplGraphicImage

member.name: T:ZplRenderer.Elements.ZplBarcode
member.summary: Represents a barcode.

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Elements.ZplBarcode.ErrorCorrectionLevel
member.summary: QR Code error correction level: 'H', 'Q', 'M', 'L'. Default 'M'.

member.summary: Interface for ZPL label renderers.

member.summary: Background color for the label (default white).

member.summary: Renders a ZPL label to a bitmap.

member.summary: Saves a rendered bitmap to a file.

member.name: T:ZplRenderer.Rendering.FieldOrientation
member.summary: Orientation/rotation values for ZPL fields.

member.name: T:ZplRenderer.Rendering.PrintOrientation
member.summary: Print orientation for the entire label (^PO).

member.name: T:ZplRenderer.Rendering.RenderContext
member.summary: Maintains parsing state and accumulates elements during ZPL processing. This context is used during the Command Execution phase to build the ZplElement model.

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Rendering.RenderContext.Elements
member.summary: The list of elements parsed so far.

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Rendering.RenderContext.PendingBarcode
member.summary: Pending barcode configuration. If set, the next ^FD will generate a barcode element using this config.

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Rendering.RenderContext.CurrentX
member.summary: Current field origin X position in dots.

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Rendering.RenderContext.CurrentY
member.summary: Current field origin Y position in dots.

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Rendering.RenderContext.LabelHomeX
member.summary: Label home X offset in dots (^LH).

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Rendering.RenderContext.LabelHomeY
member.summary: Label home Y offset in dots (^LH).

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Rendering.RenderContext.LabelShiftX
member.summary: Label shift X offset in dots (^LS). Shifts all field positions.

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Rendering.RenderContext.LabelTop
member.summary: Label top offset in dots (^LT). Moves the entire label content vertically.

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Rendering.RenderContext.GraphicsCache
member.summary: Cache for downloaded graphics (~DG). Key: Image name, Value: SkiaSharp Bitmap.

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Rendering.RenderContext.DpiX
member.summary: Horizontal DPI (state only, used for sizing/scaling logic if needed).

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Rendering.RenderContext.PrintOrientation
member.summary: Global print orientation (^PO).

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Rendering.RenderContext.EncodingId
member.summary: Current code page / encoding map ID (^CI). Default 0 (USA 1).

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.Rendering.RenderContext.GetEncoding
member.summary: Gets the current encoding based on EncodingId (^CI).

member.name: T:ZplRenderer.Utils.ZplFontInfo
member.summary: ZPL font characteristics including system font name and style.

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.Utils.ZplFontInfo.AspectRatio
member.summary: Width to height ratio for this font (used when width is not specified). ZPL bitmap fonts have specific aspect ratios.

member.name: T:ZplRenderer.Utils.FontMappings
member.summary: Provides mapping between ZPL font identifiers and system font families. ZPL fonts are designated by single letters (A-Z) or digits (0-9). Font 0 is the scalable "Swiss 721" style font. Fonts A-H are bitmap fonts with specific sizes.

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.Utils.FontMappings.GetSystemFont(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the system font name for a ZPL font identifier.

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.Utils.FontMappings.GetFontInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Gets detailed font information for a ZPL font identifier.

member.name: T:ZplRenderer.ZplEngine
member.summary: Main entry point for the ZPL Renderer library. Parses ZPL code and renders label previews.

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.ZplEngine.DefaultDpi
member.summary: Default DPI for rendering (203 is standard for many Zebra printers).

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.ZplEngine.DefaultWidthDots
member.summary: Default label width in dots.

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.ZplEngine.DefaultHeightDots
member.summary: Default label height in dots.

member.name: P:ZplRenderer.ZplEngine.BackgroundColor
member.summary: Background color for rendered labels.

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.ZplEngine.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new ZPL Engine instance.

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.ZplEngine.Render(System.String)
member.summary: Parses and renders ZPL code to a bitmap using default dimensions.
member.returns: A bitmap preview of the label.

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.ZplEngine.Render(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Parses and renders ZPL code to a bitmap with specified dimensions in dots.
member.returns: A bitmap preview of the label.

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.ZplEngine.RenderMm(System.String,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Parses and renders ZPL code to a bitmap with dimensions in millimeters.

member.summary: Parses and renders ZPL code to a bitmap with dimensions in inches.
member.returns: A bitmap preview of the label.

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.ZplEngine.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses ZPL code without rendering.

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.ZplEngine.Validate(System.String)
member.summary: Validates ZPL code and returns any warnings or errors.
member.returns: Collection of validation messages (empty if valid).

member.summary: Renders ZPL code and saves directly to a file.

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.ZplEngine.MmToDots(System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts millimeters to dots for a given DPI.

member.name: M:ZplRenderer.ZplEngine.InchesToDots(System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts inches to dots for a given DPI.

member.summary: Converts dots to millimeters for a given DPI.
